item.description:
MOOD DISORDERS

and What To Do About Them

with Dr. Adiel Tel-Oren, MD

  • * Learn from Dr. T about the nutritional, environmental and emotional causes of mood and mental disorders
  • * Be able to discern between situational and chronic mood disorders
  • *How do we find the causes so we can eliminate them?

Saturday, May 19th 9 - 10:30 AM

lecture and Q and A

Admission $20 cash/check at door or go to "events" on http://doctortevents.com

(anyone who paid $65 for the workshop will receive a refund of $45 at the door)

Free Parking across the street at the McDevitt School

 

Proceeds to benefit The Everest Learning Academy (ELA) established by Dr. T in Nepal's Ghorka District ~ providing teachers with Montessori education training & computers & Optimum Health Solution's Somerville Afterschool Program "Real Kids, Real Food"

 

FREE: Brief skin inspections for new patients after lecture, 10:30 - 11 am.

Questions: Call Betsy Bragg at 781-899-6664 or email bbski@stanfordalumni.org

Visit: www.OptimumHealthSolution.org for more details and watch 3-minute video with Dr. T.

REMINDER: Skin Clinic, Friday, May 18, 5:00 - 9 pm; Saturday May 19th 1:30 - 5:00 pm

Skin Appointments being scheduled for Lesions, Tags, Blemishes Removed. www.DoctorTEvents.com

About: Dr. Adiel Tel‐Oren (known as “Dr. T”)  is a renowned holistic scientist, author, innovator, and educator – consulting for medical laboratories and medical-nutritional product manufacturers, formulating new products, designing Green Buildings, producing CD’s & DVD’s, appearing on Radio & TV shows, and lecturing to doctors, health practitioners, corporations, government organizations, and the public worldwide on Natural Principles, Medicine, Nutrition, and Sustainability.

He is a licensed European Medical Doctor trained in Europe and in the USA, a US‐licensed, Board‐Certified Nutritionist and professor with the International & American Association of Clinical Nutritionists, board‐certified by the American Board of Functional Medicine, American Board of Chelation Therapy, American Clinical Board of Nutrition, and the American Board of Disability Analysts, and a retired Doctor of Chiropractic.

He is also President Emeritus and Professor of Medical Sciences & Functional medicine at the University of Natural Medicine in Santa Fe.

Dr. T has traveled extensively, offering humanitarian medical care and researching indigenous nutrition practices in Africa, East and South Asia, Europe, the Americas, and the Tropics. He is the Founder of several non‐profit programs worldwide, including The Everest Learning Academy - a network of schools for Orphans and Disadvantaged Nepali Children; a Nepali Community Health Plan caring for 200,000 villagers; The Israeli Center for Functional Medicine; The Eco‐Sphere Green Community Project and Permaculture CSA in Wisconsin; and the Ecopolitan Eco‐Health Network with its numerous communities in the USA ‐ supporting healthy lifestyle, Eco‐Raw Restaurants, Healing Retreats, Clinics, University Degrees and Certification Programs, as well as Tropical Escapes, Foraging trips, and Humanitarian Eco‐Trekking adventures in the Himalayas. Dr. T is also founder of the world's first hypoallergenic GF/DF vegan bakery.
item.name: Mood Disorders and What To Do About Them with Dr. Adiel Tel-Oren
